values.text:
`EOC Communications Manager`
During the course of an EOC activation event, the EOC Communications Manager is responsible for many communications elements, described in the sections below.  The EOC Communications Manager is focused on outbound EOC communications and provides essential and pivotal leadership to ensure the stakeholders’ communications needs are understood and met. The EOC Communications Manager role is defined in the EOC Communications Notebook on DMD (DMD Notebooks).

`EOC Communications Manager responsibilities include, but are not limited to: `

•	Work very closely with the EOC National Manager in all things related to communications.
•	Work very closely with the EOC Scribe in all outbound EOC communications.
•	Use the EOC Communications Checklist in the EOC Communications Plan and Guidance notebook for guidance, as appropriate.
•	Set EOC direction with and provide guidance to those who deliver EOC outbound communications to ensure seamless communications. 
•	Understand event related outbound communications requirements, including but not limited to those from the EOC National Manager (i.e. talking points for customer discussions, situation status updates, media, etc.).
•	Establish which outbound message types, methods, and frequency will be used for the specific EOC event and activation levels. 
•	Understand the ongoing situation status.
•	Set and maintain the standardized approach to EOC outbound communication for the specific event in the EOC at-a-glance outbound communications matrix.
•	Develop guidance for one-on-one communications with customers or client teams.
•	Schedule and host an all-SDPA meeting to provide communications guidance regarding informing customers of possible impacts and pro-active or ongoing customer wellness check talking points. 
•	Verify the SDPAs are calling their customers and documenting the calls in the Customer Communications view.
•	Develop or approve all EOC outbound messages for distribution.
•	Enforce use of standard message templates containing recommended outbound message verbiage and modify, as necessary.
•	Initiate pro-active or ongoing wellness check calling, if and when requested by the EOC National Manager
•	Interface and work closely with IBM Communications to provide event relevant information to enable IBM communications to accurately communicate BCRS event activity to the news media, social media, and press releases.
•	Be available for BCRS Executive Management decision and information calls and reviews.
•	Etc.
<notes://ppywdcdom0101.sl.bluecloud.ibm.com/85257CEF00680083|DMD>

Hello  @object_of_interest,  Good day. How may i help you today ?. 👩‍✈️
Listed below are the SDPA modules for your support and assistance. 
Click on the desired modules or enter your question / query on the SDPA context.

`1. T-24 means 24 weeks to the Event Date.`
After you obtain the Date from customer , enter the date range in the PRISM tool
work with Schedulers for confirming the date
Take Customers  consent
Confirm the Scheduled date in the PRISM 
Once confirmed , communicate with customer through SAP tool.
During T-24 , as an SDPA ,  Initiate communication to the customer and ensure following steps are done before T-16
2. During T-24 to T-16 ensure, initiate the communication with customers.
3. Check if the customer is looking for any DR Event schedule.
4. Request Customer for any Contract updates
5. Check if any risks are involved 
6.  Check if any additional requirement like POC / Mini test / Nettest etc

Review and understand the contract 
⇛Identify Key stakeholders
⇛Conduct a Kick-off meeting - Make sure everyone understands what the project is going to accomplish, what's in the agreement?
⇛Schedule / Iterations - What's going to happen when?
⇛Impediments / Risk - Where do the potential impediments, blockers, risks, issues lie?
⇛Financial Plan - How much funding , how many resources,etc are available?
⇛Status Report - What needs to be communicated?
⇛Initiate communication with stakeholder and  follow T-20 - T1 Process
`In - Detail::-`
1.  Logon to SAP and read the contract thoroughly and understand over all solution and if there  
     are shared contracts between multiple companies .
2.  Thoroughly conduct stakeholders analysis 
3. Check for any already scheduled dates in the system (SAP & PRISM)
4. check for usage history and check for available hrs and events.
5. Check for any previous issues in SAP.
6. Understand Visio diagram and other deliverable s if available from previous event.
7. Check for communication Log and event logs.
8. Introduce yourself to the customer and mark cc to your Account Manager
9. Request for Scheduling an event if not scheduled yet ?
10. Learn T-24 Process

`Event Types`
An event has a specific start time and a duration for a specific customer. A customer may have more than one event type associated with their visit. Possible event types are (but not limited to):
⇛BCS = Business Capacity Services
⇛ EDUC = Education
⇛ HOLD = Holding Time on Calendar
⇛ MAINT = General Maintenance
⇛ NETTEST = Subset of Network Configuration
⇛ RRESTOR = Rapid Recovery Exercise
⇛RRTEST = Rapid Recovery Test
⇛ RECOVERY = Resiliency Services Disaster Recovery
⇛ SETUP = Complex Event Preparation
⇛ BREAKDOWN = Complex Event Preparation
⇛ SVS = Solutions Validation Services

⇛ PARTTEST - For Partial Period Allocations
⇛ OTHERSVC = Other Services Test
⇛ QATEST = Quality Assurance Test
⇛ SITEMNT = Site Maintenance

The Rapid Open Provisioning (ROP) portal is a website that allows customers to provide to IBM with information with which to set up their Intel / Client-Server environment.  ROP accepts data regarding UCS Blades* (e.g. compute resources/environment), legacy physical servers such as IBM 3850 C's etc, and VDI requirements.  A customer enters their "project" (e.g. their recovery data) into the portal so we have it for tests and at time of the disaster, similarly to having information on file in the form of a worksheet.  The advantage of using ROP is that it allows IBM Resiliency Services to employ automation to deploy the project and build the recovery environment quickly, giving our customers a faster RPO.

Link for IRP::-🔗 <https://www.ibm.com/services/us-en/it-services/business-continuity/resiliency-portal/|IRP DashBoard> 


Link for ROP ::-🔗 <https://ropus.mybluemix.net/secure/|ROP4 Access>
<https://ropus.mybluemix.net/secure/index.html#/project/new|ROP Project>

`Information on SysSnap`
IBM Resiliency Services strives to continually improve our clients resiliency.  To that end IBM has been designing a suite of programs (collectively known as IRIS) designed to eliminate pretest worksheets and streamline your DR planning effort.  Right now we are ready to beta test our IRIS Open Systems worksheet replacement discovery tool, "SysSnap", and I believe you are a strong candidate to participate.  SysSnap collects configuration data for automatic worksheet generation and equipment provisioning and provides numerous efficiencies to your organization's continuity program.  There is no cost to participate in this beta program, however there are numerous benefits to you, some of which include the following: 

AUTO Generated Worksheets
	
	-All system configuration data (Storage, CPU, Memory, OS levels, Network) is reposed at 
	IBM
	-You never have to fill out a worksheet again

ALWAYS ready DR Configuration

	-IBM has up to date requirements instantly on hand during an outage emergency
	-Data collection can be automated via a scheduled job
	-Production changes are captured as they happen and do not require client intervention
	-Ensured accuracy of "deliverable" documentation
	-IBM can ensure contract matches production environment where applicable

PRETEST Efficiency

	-IBM provides worksheet for client approval
	-Minimal pretest call
	-You get time back on your schedule

NEXT Level DR/Client Benefit

	-Be on the forefront of IBM's transformation
	-Data collection used as provisioning input
	-Reduced labor planning costs
	-Possibly reduce RTO

`Cross-Site Recovery Exercise` 

To submit a recovery exercise request at a recovery site location other than the primary location for which the signed contract is registered, indicate the site at which the recovery exercise is to be scheduled on the scheduling request in PRISM.

The scheduler sends a confirmed recovery exercise date note back to the Service Delivery Program Advisor who requested the cross-site recovery exercise.  If the Service Delivery Program Advisor that is primarily responsible for the customer needs a Service Delivery Program Advisor at the scheduled site to assist with the exercise, it is the Primary Service Delivery Program Advisor’s responsibility to send a note to the Cross Site Assignor at the scheduled site requesting assistance.  If the exercise is to take place insideT10, the owing SDPA must gather all approvals from the cross-site. 

The originating site Service Delivery Program Advisor will offer the date to the customer and confirm back to the scheduler.  Refer to the Cross Site SDPA Roles document in the Customer Support Team Room under SDPA Process, View this Section, All Sites, Cross Site SDPA Roles for further details on this subject.

0-30 minutes – Customer attempts to reach support via Event Support Line number, leaving message containing Company name, caller’s name, short issue description and call / contact back information.  
After 30 minutes – Customer may escalate to SDPA that they have been unable to get through to desired support group. `Service Sales Leader ` (SSL) is your single primary contact into IBM Resiliency Services.
SSLs have the responsibility for reviewing your goals, objectives, and budget priorities for IBM Resiliency Services, communicating new offerings, ensuring responsiveness to your requests in all areas of IBM Resiliency Services, engaging other sales and support specialists to address your needs, and ensuring your overall satisfaction with us.
Your SSL is your interface, should you ever need to revise your services contract (for instance, an upgrade to your subscribed IT recovery configuration). Your SSLs will periodically review their customer accounts and contact you to:
•	Validate the accuracy of the configuration and network services listed in your Supplement(s) for Multivendor Information Technology Recovery Services.
•	Determine if you need to add and/or delete equipment to your contracted recovery configuration, because of changes to your requirements.
•	Review any changes that IBM plans to make to our equipment inventory at the recovery site, which might impact your contracted configuration requirements.
You shouldn't hesitate to give your SSL a call if you have a question about recovery services. You never need to know the "right" person to call because if your SSL doesn't know the answer, he or she will find someone who does.

IBM Resiliency Services strives to continually improve our clients resiliency.  To that end IBM has been designing a suite of programs (collectively known as IRIS) designed to eliminate pretest worksheets and streamline your DR planning effort.  Right now we are ready to  test our IRIS Open Systems worksheet replacement discovery tool, "SysSnap",  SysSnap collects configuration data for automatic worksheet generation and equipment provisioning and provides numerous efficiencies to your organization's continuity program.  however there are numerous benefits to you, some of which include the following: 

AUTO Generated Worksheets
	
	-All system configuration data (Storage, CPU, Memory, OS levels, Network) is reposed at 
	IBM
	-You never have to fill out a worksheet again

ALWAYS ready DR Configuration

	-IBM has up to date requirements instantly on hand during an outage emergency
	-Data collection can be automated via a scheduled job
	-Production changes are captured as they happen and do not require client intervention
	-Ensured accuracy of "deliverable" documentation
	-IBM can ensure contract matches production environment where applicable

PRETEST Efficiency

	-IBM provides worksheet for client approval
	-Minimal pretest call
	-You get time back on your schedule

NEXT Level DR/Client Benefit

	-Be on the forefront of IBM's transformation
	-Data collection used as provisioning input
	-Reduced labor planning costs
	-Possibly reduce RTO

 Few Best Practices:-

Status Report - What needs to be communicated?

An event has a specific start time and a duration for a specific customer. A customer may have more than one event type associated with their visit. Possible event types are (but not limited to):

Right now we are ready to  test our IRIS Open Systems worksheet replacement discovery tool, "SysSnap",  SysSnap collects configuration data for automatic worksheet generation and equipment provisioning and provides numerous efficiencies to your organization's continuity program.  however there are numerous benefits to you, some of which include the following: 

AUTO Generated Worksheets
	
	-All system configuration data (Storage, CPU, Memory, OS levels, Network) is reposed at 
	IBM
	-You never have to fill out a worksheet again

ALWAYS ready DR Configuration

	-IBM has up to date requirements instantly on hand during an outage emergency
	-Data collection can be automated via a scheduled job
	-Production changes are captured as they happen and do not require client intervention
	-Ensured accuracy of "deliverable" documentation
	-IBM can ensure contract matches production environment where applicable

PRETEST Efficiency

	-IBM provides worksheet for client approval
	-Minimal pretest call
	-You get time back on your schedule

NEXT Level DR/Client Benefit

	-Be on the forefront of IBM's transformation
	-Data collection used as provisioning input
	-Reduced labor planning costs
	-Possibly reduce RTO

`Cross-Site Recovery Exercise` 

To submit a recovery exercise request at a recovery site location other than the primary location for which the signed contract is registered, indicate the site at which the recovery exercise is to be scheduled on the scheduling request in PRISM.

The scheduler sends a confirmed recovery exercise date note back to the Service Delivery Program Advisor who requested the cross-site recovery exercise.  If the Service Delivery Program Advisor that is primarily responsible for the customer needs a Service Delivery Program Advisor at the scheduled site to assist with the exercise, it is the Primary Service Delivery Program Advisor’s responsibility to send a note to the Cross Site Assignor at the scheduled site requesting assistance.  If the exercise is to take place insideT10, the owing SDPA must gather all approvals from the cross-site. 

The originating site Service Delivery Program Advisor will offer the date to the customer and confirm back to the scheduler.  Refer to the Cross Site SDPA Roles document in the Customer Support Team Room under SDPA Process, View this Section, All Sites, Cross Site SDPA Roles for further details on this subject.

`Why are we charging our clients .`
•	We no longer offer any “give-aways” during an exercise.  Additional hardware or services may now be secured for a one time fee in the event contract revisions are not effective prior to the start date of the exercise.  
•	A core team of Service Delivery personnel will be authorized to generate a One Time Charge for the client, via SAP and a Work Authorization for Additional Services. 
`Our Role.`
Send request for One Time Charge to a team member for processing and copy BCRS Upgrades/Gaithersburg/IBM.
`One Time Charge Focal Points`
`One Time Charge Request Form`
`Processing of One Time Charges`
After client and IBM signatures have been obtain, scan the Work Authorization and store in COMDOC as SALES - Letter of Authorization.  For IGA Accounts, an email approval of the Work Authorization is acceptable.  Please generate a PDF of the email and store in COMDOC as above.
`Post Event Activities.`
At the completion of the client’s exercise, send the required documentation to the Contract Operations Team (copying BCRS Upgrades/Gaithersburg/IBM).  
`Running/Viewing Your One Time Charge Report.`
From SAP Easy Access Menu.
Create OTC Report Shortcut.
`Creation of Forecast Records – Not Event Related.`
From Customer Information Search, left click on the contract associated with the charge.
`Creation of Forecast Records – Event Related.`
From Event Search, left click on the contract associated with the charge
`Creation of Forecast Records .`
Likelihood to bill guidelines:
Stretch – Opportunity has been identified, but, no commitment from customer.
At Risk – Opportunity has been identified and accepted by client, however, total amount may change and Release/Bill Month may change
Solid – Opportunity has been identified and accepted and charges will be released in the month forecasted
`Creation of Forecast Records .`
Release Month:
Indicates the Month/Year (MM/YYYY) in which the charge is to be released
Bill Month: 
Indicates the Month/Year (MM/YYYY) in which the charge is expected to bill.  Unless directed otherwise, Bill Month and Release Month should be the same.
Comments for Internal Use:
Indicate what is required before the charge can be released.
`Handling of Contract-Based One Time Charges .`
When work has been completed or milestone has been reached, advise Billing Focal that work has been completed and One Time Charge can be released.
 Open the Forecast Record:
Ensure Likelihood to Bill = Solid
Ensure Bill Mo and Release Mo accurately reflect when the Billing Focal was advised that the charge could be released
Ensure the Forecast Actual represents the correct One Time Charge value
 Click on ‘Submit’ (If charge type is ‘Other’, click on ‘Release’).
Next Steps -  Create/Update Forecast Records.
Open your One Time Charge report to review for accuracy 
 System generated One Time Charges are on your report now for events in the next 6 months.  Update the Likelihood to Bill, Bill Month and Release Month, and provide any pertinent comments in Comments for Internal Use
 If you know for certain a system generated charge is going to be waived, update Forecast Assessed to reflect $0 and provide detail in Comments for Internal Use
 For non system generated charges, create the Forecast Records
 For Revenue Split contracts, if you know SO is going to be covering the charge, you can use this opportunity to request the accounting codes that will be used.

When you receive Cost Valuation Reports
Review Client Contract (Billable or Accumulated)
If billable, generate forecast charge and send spreadsheet to billing focal

* CLOSEOUT:
-⇛Understand from client when event is complete, be it being told OR knowing otherwise
-⇛Obtain device configurations as needed prior to teardown (e.g., CISCO device configs)
-⇛Inform appropriate groups via email of event being complete
-⇛Inform rapid recovery if needed so disconnects between IBM RS and client can occur
-⇛Work as needed with media management to get client media and eqpt shipped back
-⇛Understand how the environment might have changed during event, and notate any changes to client so worksheets can be modified with the new requirements
-⇛Work with infrastructure on any additional connects / changes being needed as a result of discovery from the event
-⇛Understand fully if any waivers are needed prior to billing, and if a re-test is needed
-⇛Bill event as needed per usage for the event
-⇛Follow through on survey with client if needed
-⇛Arrange and hold Post Test Review if needed:
-⇛obtain specific issues from client.

`Process:`
**NOTE:  Execute and Control are both cycles that occur when the event is running, and are thus very interconnecting**
*EXECUTE:
-Either meet client in suite OR technical area such as tape room to kickoff event if attendees are on site.  Kick off via phone call if remote
-Introduce floor support and other needed personnel (RR, APSU, AT&T, RPE Resources) to client
-Show client around as needed including tape drives, COE, equipment, servers
-Engage skills teams at event start, to work with client or provide contact information
-Assure all rules of media management are fully known to all.

* CONTROL:
-Work with client on event scope creep such as additional resources needed:
--tape drives, disk, additional system resources
--additional connects to COE / RR
--Connectivity issues
--Lack of knowledgebase by client, may need outside support.  One can draw on sales team and / or client exec for assistance
--Troubleshooting, to prove IBM RS is not at fault (e.g., loads on circuits / connections not pegged, status of switches and other interlinking devices)

-Enhance communications as needed between skills teams and client
-Maintain contact with client through periodic "check ins"
-Engage media team as needed for escalations / assistance as needed
-Work with client to understand if additional test time is needed / warranted.  If so, work with floor teams, rapid recovery, scheduling, and management as needed, and communicate as needed so all teams are aware.

⇛`Event Types`
An event has a specific start time and a duration for a specific customer. A customer may have more than one event type associated with their visit. Possible event types are (but not limited to):
⇛BCS = Business Capacity Services
⇛ EDUC = Education
⇛ HOLD = Holding Time on Calendar
⇛ MAINT = General Maintenance
⇛ NETTEST = Subset of Network Configuration
⇛ RRESTOR = Rapid Recovery Exercise
⇛RRTEST = Rapid Recovery Test
⇛ RECOVERY = Resiliency Services Disaster Recovery
⇛ SETUP = Complex Event Preparation
⇛ BREAKDOWN = Complex Event Preparation
⇛ SVS = Solutions Validation Services
⇛ TEST = Resiliency Services Recovery Exercise
⇛ PARTTEST - For Partial Period Allocations
⇛ OTHERSVC = Other Services Test
⇛ QATEST = Quality Assurance Test
⇛ SITEMNT = Site Maintenance
`Domains`
An event type is associated with a domain. A domain is the platform and/or skill group involved in the delivery of the event. An event can have one or more of the following domains associated with the event. Some potential domains include (but not limited to):
⇛ BBN = BCRS Backbone
⇛ CDV = Cloud Data Virtualization
⇛CMD = Cloud Managed Distributed
⇛ CME = Cloud Managed Enterprise
⇛ CMS = Cloud Manged Services
⇛ CS = Client Services

⇛ HP = Hewlett Packard
⇛ IPS = Information Protection Services
⇛ LS = Large-systems

`IBM Resiliency Services 
Test Support Contact Escalation Path`

0-30 minutes – Customer attempts to reach support via Event Support Line number, leaving message containing Company name, caller’s name, short issue description and call / contact back information.  
After 30 minutes – Customer may escalate to SDPA that they have been unable to get through to desired support group. dialog_nodes.title: Customer asking for a SOA/Quote for any SRT Activities

values.text:
*Use Case*
`One of my customer asking for a SOA/Quote for any SRT Activities.   They want to send few tapes over to RTP to be inserted and have any tapes existing in the I/O hopper (COE) be sent back at the same time.   As per SRT, this activity covers under Item Code : xxx.xx with rate code A i.e, $ xxx per hour.     Already informed the customer on the rates and activities.  But, still they are looking for a quote/soa for thier internal account purpose.    Do we provide such ? if so, should I follow OTC process to WA ?`

Ans:-I would start by determining how many tapes and ask RTP Tape Team for estimate of time then you can provide email with that - we would not provide a work authorization for the activity - and it’s an “estimate” based on information provided by the client etc.

generic.title: IBM Business Resiliency Services - Interactive Resiliency Portal Process Doc

values.text:
Please click on below link to access IRP portal:
🔗 <https://www.ibm.com/services/us-en/it-services/business-continuity/resiliency-portal/target="resiliency"|IRP DashBoard>

The orchestration for IBM Resiliency Services (SRT)

For onboarding following are the steps:
1) Getting Started ***Request IBM ID 

Access to the Orchestra solution uses the IBM web ID. The users need to register their IDs and passwords on ibm.com. After the IBM ID is registered, then they should have access to the Orchestra. Please create the ID using their email addresses provided earlier. If this is not possible, then please send us the new ID so we can update their profile in Orchestra.

To register with ibm.com:
1) Go to 🔗<https://www.ibm.com/account/profile/us|IBM ID>
2) Click on Register in the right navigation

3) Enter your current business e-mail address as the IBM ID. Enter the password that you would like to use (minimum 8 characters). Create a security question of your preference and enter the answer to your question. This will be useful should you forget your password. Enter your e-mail address and choose the country in which you reside. Click on Continue at the bottom of the page when done. Once you have id send it to your SDPA and He/ She has it registered for you. 

===============================================
To raise an SRT, kindly click on the below link and follow the instructions provided in the documentation ..
🔗<https://www-01.ibm.com/easytools/runtime/hsp4/protect/orchestra/R01/Home.wss target="Orchistra"|SRT Link> 

To download SRT Guide, please visit below link: IRP Portal at below link and click on SRT option
🔗<https://www.ibm.com/services/us-en/it-services/business-continuity/resiliency-portal/"target="resiliency"|IRP DashBoard> 

Once SRT is opened concern team will be assigned and activity will be formed according to your request details  ..  
Provide your ticket details to your SDPA for further status updates and billing if applicable.

`Process`
`NOTE:`  Monitoring and Control are both cycles that occur when the event is running, and are thus very interconnecting.

`MONITORING:`
-Either meet client in suite OR technical area such as tape room to kickoff event if attendees are on site.  Kick off via phone call if remote
-Introduce floor support and other needed personnel (RR, APSU, AT&T, RPE Resources) to client
-Show client around as needed including tape drives, COE, equipment, servers
-Engage skills teams at event start, to work with client or provide contact information
-Assure all rules of media management are fully known to all.

`CONTROL:`
-⇛Work with client on event scope creep such as additional resources needed:
-⇛tape drives, disk, additional system resources
-⇛additional connects to COE / RR
-⇛Connectivity issues
-⇛Lack of knowledge base by client, may need outside support.  One can draw on sales team and / or client exec for assistance
-⇛Troubleshooting, to prove IBM RS is not at fault (e.g., loads on circuits / connections not pegged, status of switches and other interlinking devices)

-⇛Enhance communications as needed between skills teams and client
-⇛Maintain contact with client through periodic "check ins"
-⇛Engage media team as needed for escalations / assistance as needed
-⇛Work with client to understand if additional test time is needed / warranted.  If so, work with floor teams, rapid recovery, scheduling, and management as needed, and communicate as needed so all teams are aware.

`*Application links (SAP, PRISM, IRP)`
`IRP Link :`  ⇛🔗<https://www.ibm.com/services/us-en/it-services/business-continuity/resiliency-portal/|IRP DashBoard> 

`PRISM  Link : `⇛🔗<https://ppywdcwebp201.sl.bluecloud.ibm.com/bcrs/prism/|DFCP>
  
`*Outputs / Checklist`
-⇛Issue logs.
-⇛Lessons learned .
-⇛Event success rating.

Deliverables 		Issue Log			Event Support numbers

We, at IBM Resiliency Services, are pleased to announce launch of Interactive Resiliency Portal (IRP).  This is a web-based single sign on portal with standard Document flow and version control.  

An important feature of IRP is:  
·View your contracts and scheduled exercises 
· Document repository
·Manage exercise documents through workflow, including an approval process
·Notifications of workflow activities
·Manage personnel information

The link is provided below for more details .. for further assistance , please contact your SDPA

 <https://www.ibm.com/services/us-en/it-services/business-continuity/resiliency-portal/"target="resiliency"|IRP DashBoard>

1. Login with your IBM ID credentials
2. Click on Schedule a new exercise 
3. submit your excercise with date range toi check for availibility

values.text: IF a client makes an official request for the new annual SRT rates, please contact Diane Clem or Viru Ramapragada and a letter will be provided with the new rates and activities.

Your company can declare an Outage Emergency as defined in your IBM Business Resiliency Services contract(s). The contract defines an “Outage Emergency” as follows:   
“An Outage Emergency is any unplanned interruption of your critical business and information processing at a Covered Address, resulting from causes beyond your control that significantly impairs your ability to operate your business.”   
Some examples of an unplanned interruption include:  
 • Building or region evacuation mandated by Public Authorities impacting access to buildings, systems, network, facilities  
 • Destruction of systems or network due to a natural disaster (fire, flood, wind etc.) 
  • Unanticipated loss of power or network   .
 
*There is a recovery only contract,  for the real disaster to activate,( In your case it is  CFXXXXX ) in the event of the real disaster. or to place an alert, as a proactive measure. 
*Look at the contract and discuss IBM RS contractual commitment for these, based on your contact entitlements: 
*Configuration turn-over (typically 24 hours, but not always). 
*Coldsite entitlements. 
*Discuss COE and COE network support.  (See Q&A below)
*Discuss the customer's responsibility for data erasure, the time needed to perform it, and *IBM RS's options for data erasure.  

`Client FAQs `
`Question:  When can you declare?  `
Answer: If you are under a state of Emergency causing loss of access to your site, road closures, evacuation orders -  that does qualify as a condition to declare.

`Question:  Can you send people in advance of the potential disaster?   `
Answer:  While we are available to respond to your needs, you can only send people to a delivery center after you have called in to declare an outage emergency and been placed in one of our delivery centers.

`Question:  Can you send tapes in advance?`
Answer:  Remind them to keep in mind, your placement in a IBM RS center is dependent on when you declare an outage emergency.  Therefore, if you send your tapes in advance you may need to arrange to ship the tapes to another location, if your placement location is not where you originally shipped them to

`Question:  Will IBM RS contact our network service provider about an outage on a circuit we own?  `
Answer:  No.  It is up to the circuit owner to work with the service provider.  IBM RScannot contact service providers for circuits on the customer's behalf.    

`Question:  What will IBM RS do to help diagnose customer owned circuit issues? ` 
Answer:  IBM RS will determine if the IBM RS environment is operational.  There may be a charge for more advanced problem determination activities.  After the current situation is resolved, your BCRS client representative will be happy to discuss options that would allow IBM RS to work with network connectivity vendors.

`Question:  What if the customer's BCP is out of synch with IBM RS's' contractual obligations?  `
Answer:  After the current situation is resolved, your IBM RSclient representative will be happy to discuss options that would more closely align IBM RS' contractual obligations with your BCP.

`Will there be charge if customer places an alert`
*No*

values.text:
⇛`Transaction codes`
N- New
AN – ADD NEW
X- Cancellation
C- Confirm
M- Modify
Q – Question about Exercise
RS – Reschedule
P- Pended

⇛`Event Types`
An event has a specific start time and a duration for a specific customer. A customer may have more than one event type associated with their visit. Possible event types are (but not limited to):
⇛BCS = Business Capacity Services
⇛ EDUC = Education
⇛ HOLD = Holding Time on Calendar
⇛ MAINT = General Maintenance
⇛ NETTEST = Subset of Network Configuration
⇛ RRESTOR = Rapid Recovery Exercise
⇛RRTEST = Rapid Recovery Test
⇛ RECOVERY = Resiliency Services Disaster Recovery
⇛ SETUP = Complex Event Preparation
⇛ BREAKDOWN = Complex Event Preparation
⇛ SVS = Solutions Validation Services
⇛ TEST = Resiliency Services Recovery Exercise
⇛ PARTTEST - For Partial Period Allocations
⇛ OTHERSVC = Other Services Test
⇛ QATEST = Quality Assurance Test
⇛ SITEMNT = Site Maintenance
`Domains`
An event type is associated with a domain. A domain is the platform and/or skill group involved in the delivery of the event. An event can have one or more of the following domains associated with the event. Some potential domains include (but not limited to):
⇛ BBN = BCRS Backbone
⇛ CDV = Cloud Data Virtualization
⇛CMD = Cloud Managed Distributed
⇛ CME = Cloud Managed Enterprise
⇛ CMS = Cloud Manged Services
⇛ CS = Client Services
⇛ DEC = Digital Equipment
⇛ HP = Hewlett Packard
⇛ IPS = Information Protection Services
⇛ LS = Large-systems
⇛ MR = Mid-range
⇛ NET = Network
⇛ OPS = Operational Services
⇛ PRT = Print/Mail
⇛ RPM = Resiliency Program Management
⇛ RMS = Recovery Management Services
⇛ RR = Rapid Recovery

⇛ SP2 = Scaleable POWER Parallel

`During Outage emergency :`

1. Call 1-877-IBM-REC1 (1-877-426-7321)  select option1
2.  Say that, you wish to declare a disaster to activate your contract(s) .
3.  The IBM call handler will gather information specific to your company, such 
      as contact information, the status of your situation, and your contact numbers. 
4. For further follow up on your emergency and other details, please contact your 
   `SDPA /Account Manager`
anything_else

`1. T-8 , 8 weeks to the DR execution date.`
2. Conduct Pre-test meetings to review  worksheets and work through IRP for deliverables ( Refer IRP process for full details)
3. Confirm if customer owned equipment ( COE) will be involved in test ? If Yes ensure
      the worksheets are filled with complete requirements and submit back before T-6.
4.  Check if addtional equipment needed to be part of DR Event ( if Yes , check for SRT
      process )
5. Check if additonal requirements are needed that not part of contract ( refer OTC process)
6.  Request for Access Media form with complete details ( if media shipment is involved) refer media shipment process ( Q&A)
7. Check if Rapid recovery is part of Exercise?
8. Obtain all scripts required if RPE is involved in the exercise .

Primary contact to Client for flawless delivery of contracted products and services within BCRS Service Delivery Centers.  Take ownership and accountability for the Client’s recovery readiness and relationship management.

`Services Sales Leader` (SSL) is your single primary contact into IBM Resiliency Services.
SSLs have the responsibility for reviewing your goals, objectives, and budget priorities for IBM Resiliency Services, communicating new offerings, ensuring responsiveness to your requests in all areas of IBM Resiliency Services, engaging other sales and support specialists to address your needs, and ensuring your overall satisfaction with us.
Your SSL is your interface, should you ever need to revise your services contract (for instance, an upgrade to your subscribed IT recovery configuration). Your SSLs will periodically review their customer accounts and contact you to:
•	Validate the accuracy of the configuration and network services listed in your Supplement(s) for Multivendor Information Technology Recovery Services.
•	Determine if you need to add and/or delete equipment to your contracted recovery configuration, because of changes to your requirements.
•	Review any changes that IBM plans to make to our equipment inventory at the recovery site, which might impact your contracted configuration requirements.
You shouldn't hesitate to give your SSL a call if you have a question about recovery services. You never need to know the "right" person to call because if your SSL doesn't know the answer, he or she will find someone who does.

`Waiver` - To refrain from pressing or enforcing (something, such as a claim or rule) : forgo waive the fee.
"We do waive off the charges for following reasons:
1. Customer satisfaction and/or retention 
2. Hardware or Software failure
3. Scheduling error 
4. Any other special requests from customers like Medical emergency etc..
`Resiliency Management and Account Management approval required."`

`Login to SAP, and do the waive off steps. Below is the glimpse on the waive off from SAP`:-

`⇛To  Revise /  process on your contracts:`
⇛Purpose Contract revision:
`You use this business process to make subsequent changes to license sales contract items that have already been released. These changes can relate to the Intellectual Property (IP), rights or distributions in sales contracts.
⇛You can make this type of contract change retroactively or non-retroactively according to the business transaction involved.
Note:-
⇛The original contract item is assigned the Completed status for a non-retroactive change and is valid until its contract end, whilst the modified contract item starts from its contract start date, (which is the day after the completed contract item ends).
⇛The type of change you make can affect subsequent processes such as confirmations, incoming royalties billing, outgoing royalties settlement, update in Profitability Analysis (CO-PA), revenue recognition and payments or partial payments in Accounting.
⇛You can perform contract revision during the entire lifecycle of a license sales contract.

`⇛Details on Contract`
⇛A contract is a legally binding agreement between 2 or more parties. A well drafted contract will;

⇛Provide clarity in business relationships, agreements and rights of parties
Avoid potential contract disputes and litigation
Prevent misinterpretation of communications and agreements
Protect intellectual property, real property and asset values
Enable better management of commercial relationships
 
⇛Contracts are comprised of 3 key elements.

⇛Offer
⇛Acceptance
⇛Consideration
⇛Offer = the client offers to pay IBM for GTS services

⇛Acceptance = IBM accepts the clients offer

⇛Consideration = the client provides monetary consideration (payment) for the services

⇛For a contract to be valid, it must adhere to certain principle.

⇛It must be entered into freely by all parties
⇛There must be an intention to create a legally binding agreement
⇛There must be an exchange of things of value (note: they do not need to be of equal value)
⇛The parties must be of sound mind (of legal age to contract, fully compos mentis - sober, mentally capable of comprehending the agreement being entered into)
⇛In certain situations a written contract is required for the agreement to be legally binding
